answers.answer: Hi,Hair loss could be due to a lot of causes. Are there other symptoms present?  This could be associated with poor nutrition, certain medications, hormonal changes, scalp infections and even certain conditions such as diabetes. It is  difficult to determine the underlying cause without direct examination and medical history. If it persists, have this evaluated further for proper management.Take care and keep us posted.
No there are no other symptoms present. I loose the most hair when im in the shower after i shampoo, is it possible that the sodium laurel sulfate is whats causing this?

There us actully another problem. Not sure if they have any connection. But I haven't gotten my period yet, I have been to the doctor for that and done a blood test, but sure enough he sent me home saying I'll get it soon. That was around 5 months go and still no period. My mother and her mother got their periods when they were 14That's about it with my medical history

question: Hello, Im a 16 year old female and i weight 110 poundsI have a strange problem with my hair.  I used to have long wavy THICK hair up untill 8 or so months ago.I feel that im loosing Way to much at this point, ive noticed a difference in the thickness and how the waves are thinning out.Its comes out in strands with a white sort of tip on the end. And when im washing it i pull out way to much, i know its normal to loose hair everyday but the amount i have in my hands when i run my fingers through is very scary.The dermatologist did not help me at all. So i feel a bit hopeless and depressedThe last time i had died my hair was 7 months ago. I never use alot of products on it, Barely brush it. And no one in my family has this.Im in desperate need of some answers. Please and thank you.
title: Strange hair loss
